name: we saved this vessel once...
description:
The cosmos, the ultimate frontier.  This is but one adventure of the vessel -xxxx- on its way through the unknown. Join the crew, follow your ambition and do your best to ensure the success of this vessel and the mission.

We saved this Vessel once is a collaborative storytelling game where 1 or more players tell the story of how their characters saved this vessel and the  mission. 

Create the ship itself and one or more crew members. Play through an episode in which you visit various locations on the ship, doing your part to complete the mission, eliminate the threat and advance your personal ambitions.

The mission, threat and twist are determined by a deck of cards. Draw from the same deck and plot your way through the ship and the adventure. Build on each other's scenes and tell a great story together.

quick Informations Players: 1  and more (reconmended 3)
Material: a deck of cards (52 cards)
Content: a full-layout version,
a print-friendly version
a plain text version in a hyper-legible font
Playtime: 2  hours, no preparation, play along possible
Triggers: bad Star Treks episodes
(Safty Tools are still advised)

This Game was first inspired by I Went to 100 Acre Wood Once by warped board games, then later re-inspired by I Went Through the Stargate Once by beth-and-angel-make-games was then forgotten for other projects but revived again by I fell into an isekai once by lucky newt games. These are all hacks from I Went to Seattle Once also by lucky newt games, which also is a hack of the original I Went to Japan Once by unknown dungeon
